The Right Robot for the Right Job
The Right Robot for the Right Job
Acquire foundational robotics knowledge, including evolution, future trends, robot anatomy and performance characteristics.
The combination of robotics automation, artificial intelligence and real-time data analytics is ushering a new era of transformation in workforce transition.

While many existing jobs will disappear due to these technological enhancements, many new jobs will also be created at the same time, and the remaining jobs will undergo some form of transformation. A workforce with strong technological skills, including robot literacy, will have a significant advantage in this new era of Industry 4.0. This workshop will introduce participants to this exciting world of robotics. It aims to equip participants with the fundamental knowledge in robotics such as evolution and future trends, anatomy of robots and performance characteristics of robots. These fundamentals will be crucial in the selection of the right robots for the right tasks. There will also be hands-on experience that will allow participants gain a better appreciation of the contents taught.

To aid companies in transforming their capabilities through their human capital, and support Singapore’s drive towards becoming a Smart Nation, this course is mapped to the Singapore Economic Development Board’s Singapore Smart Industry Readiness Index – Dimension 4 Shop Floor Automation.
Professionals who wish to understand robotics technology in general which includes:
End-users of robotics technology without any engineering background
Decision-makers looking into adopting robotics technology
Employees who need to adapt to the introduction of robotics technology in their organisation
Individuals seeking to enhance their general knowledge
Evolution and Future Trends of Robotics

This topic will look at the evolution of robots from a historical perspective, including the various types of robots developed for the different types of application, both in the industrial and non-industrial settings, as well as the upcoming trends in the current fourth industrial revolution

This topic will elaborate on the basic components that make up a robotic system, the purpose of each component and how all these components amalgamate to make a robotic system carry out the intended tasks

This topic will look into the possible arrangement of links and joints that will result in robots with different characteristics, as well as identification of a particular configuration of a robot and its associated performance parameters
Selection of the Right Robot for the Right Job
This topic will facilitate in the selection of the right robot for the right task based on the robot characteristics and the task requirements in different industrial settings
Asst Provost (Continuous Learning) /A/Prof /Deputy Dir, ARO, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Asst Provost (Continuous Learning) /A/Prof /Deputy Dir, ARO, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Mustafa is an Associate Professor in the Engineering Cluster with Singapore Institute of Technology who specializes in Robotics and Lean Manufacturing. He is also the Deputy Director of SIT’s Applied Research Office, which provides overall strategic research direction as well as overseeing research governance and grant administration. He was previously a Research Scientist at the Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology A*STAR, leading a team in industrial robotics initiatives for productivity enhancement in the local manufacturing sector. 

In addition to actively teaching and developing robotics curriculum for both undergraduate and adult learners, he provides consultancy services and actively leads applied research projects to develop robotic automation solutions in various industry sectors such as manufacturing and built environment. He holds a Bachelors in Engineering (Mechanical & Production Engineering with Mechatronics Specialization) and Doctor of Philosophy (Robotics) from the Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
Selection of the right robot for the right job
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$1,090.00.
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
